Data: {"recipient_id": "6240245e-68cb-4c85-aba7-ada2c6b69f8a", "custom": {"attachment": {"type": "template", "payload": {"template_type": "simple_form", "title": "Information for Ad Support Ticket", "description": "This form is used to collect user information in case the user needs additional help and a Jira Ticket needs to be filed with our Support Team.", "descriptionPosition": "top", "hidden_reply": true, "reply_text": "The user completes the submission of the form", "submit_button_title": "Send", "intent_name": "submit_form", "cancel_button": {"title": "Cancel", "type": "postback", "payload": "/cancel_for_input_data", "url": null, "is_enabled": false, "hidden_reply": true}, "is_mailerlite_form": false, "fields": [{"title": "Name", "type": "text", "icon_url": "https://seachat.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/images/icon-name.svg", "is_required": true, "entity_name": "_NAME"}, {"title": "Email", "type": "text", "icon_url": "https://seachat.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/images/icon-email.svg", "is_required": true, "entity_name": "_EMAIL"}, {"title": "Account ID", "type": "text", "icon_url": "", "is_required": true, "entity_name": "VAR_0001"}], "form_id": "ee27568f0b9f4826a7215c8197548501"}}}}

Message: Hi, Iâ€™m the NewsBreak Ad Assistant. How can I help?
The user completes the submission of the form
agent
I'm here to help with whatever you need! Let me know your question, and I'll do my best to assist you right away.
My ad says its active but its asking for event needed for delivery

It sounds like your ad requires event tracking to optimize its delivery. Could you let me know which tracking platform or service you're using for the pixel or postback? This will help me provide more specific guidance.
I dont have one

No worries! You can set up event tracking using NewsBreak's options. Here are a few methods you can consider:

1. **JavaScript Pixel Tracking**: Implement a lightweight JavaScript pixel directly on your website to capture events in real-time.

2. **Google Tag Manager (GTM) & Shopify**: Deploy our tracking script using Google Tag Manager or integrate with Shopify's event tracking system.

3. **Server-to-Server (S2S) Postback**: For more robust tracking, especially in mobile and affiliate marketing, use Server-to-Server postbacks.

For detailed instructions, you can refer to our [Event Tracking Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/25226963388813-How-to-integrate-a-general-NewsBreak-Postback). Let me know if you need further assistance!
do I have to add this

Yes, adding event tracking is important for optimizing your ad delivery. It helps in measuring conversions and user engagement effectively. Without it, the system may not be able to optimize your ad performance fully. If you need help setting it up, feel free to ask!
I dont wont to add it

That's completely fine! While event tracking can enhance ad performance by providing insights into user interactions, it's not mandatory. However, without it, you might miss out on some optimization benefits. If you change your mind or need help with anything else, just let me know!
how do I know my add is running

To check if your ad is running, you can go to the 'Ad Management' section on the NewsBreak platform. Here, you should see the status of your ad listed as 'Active.' You can also monitor performance metrics like impressions, clicks, and conversions to ensure it's reaching your audience. If you need more detailed insights or have any questions, feel free to ask!
how can I get a link to my ad

To get a link to your ad, you can access the 'Ad Management' section in your NewsBreak Ad Manager. From there, find the specific ad you want to share and look for an option to view or preview the ad. This should provide you with a direct link or URL that you can use. If you need further assistance, feel free to ask!
Thank you for your feedback. You can click the close icon below to close this widget.
I can't find the link to my ad

If you're having trouble finding the link to your ad, try these steps:

1. **Log into your NewsBreak Ad Manager**: Go to the 'Ad Management' section.
2. **Locate Your Campaign**: Find the specific campaign and ad set where your ad is located.
3. **Preview Option**: Look for a 'Preview' or 'View Ad' option next to your ad. This should provide you with a direct link or URL.

If these steps don't help, please let me know, and we can explore other options!
doesn't help

I'm sorry to hear that. If you're unable to find the link through the Ad Manager, I recommend reaching out to our support team at adsupport@newsbreak.com for further assistance. They can help you locate the link or resolve any issues you might be facing.
